meanings.definition: To wind or coil something inward.
meanings.sent1: She carefully inwinding the thread around the spool.
meanings.sent2: The snake was inwinding itself around the tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: The cat found the inwinding motion of the yarn amusing.
meanings.sent4: The ivy inwinding around the old house gave it a mysterious look.
meanings.sent5: The inwinding river carved a beautiful path through the valley.

meanings.definition: To become wound or coiled inward.
meanings.sent1: The rope inwinding around the pole tightened with each turn.
meanings.sent2: The wire was inwinding into a tight coil.
meanings.sent3: The dancer's inwinding movements on stage amused the audience.
meanings.sent4: The fog inwinding through the forest created an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The inwinding path led us deeper into the forest.
